contentrichtext.text: '''Kaila Holtz''' (born September 26, 1981 in [[Edmonton, Alberta]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.olympic.ca/en/athletes/kaila-holtz/videos/|title=Kaila Holtz|publisher=[[Canadian Olympic Committee]]|accessdate=22 April 2010}}</ref>) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[softball]] [[pitcher]]. She began playing softball at age 10, and has attended the [[University of Massachusetts Amherst]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.umassathletics.com/sports/w-softbl/spec-rel/061205aaa.html|title=Kaila Holtz Leads Canadian Softball Team To Third-Place Finish At International Sports Invitational|date=12 June 2005|work=Umass.com|publisher=[[University of Massachusetts Amherst]]|accessdate=22 April 2010}}</ref> She was a part of the Canadian Softball team who finished 5th at the [[2004 Summer Olympics]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cstv.com/sports/m-footbl/stories/083104aam.html|title=UMass Football Radio Show Begins Thursday|date=31 August 2004|work=cstv.com|publisher=CSTV|accessdate=22 April 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Holtz, Kaila | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian softball player | DATE OF BIRTH = 26 September 1981 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Holtz, Kaila}} [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Massachusetts Amherst alumni]] [[Category:College softball players in the United States]] [[Category:Olympic softball players of Canada]] [[Category:Softball players at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:People from Edmonton]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Alberta]] [[Category:Canadian people of German descent]] [[Category:Canadian softball players]] {{Canada-softball-bio-stub}}
